ygData.subject: Postponed Rock of Ages
ygData.msgSnippet: Unknown Robots: Deep within the depths of Cybertron in Predacon controlled territory a small Predacon was running as fast as he could, ducking between corners

Subject: Postponed Rock of Ages
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: CompuServe 2000 32-bit sub 107
From: KSLawdogg@...

Unknown Robots:






Deep within the depths of Cybertron in Predacon controlled territory a small 
Predacon was running as fast as he could, ducking between corners and alleys, 
looking over his shoulder every few seconds spotting nothing, but he could 
hear it.  The distant sound of someone or something playing hard on an 
electric guitar or two.

The Predacon turned another corner, a dead end.  He looked around, the once 
faint sound getting louder and louder.  Full of fear, he began pounding on 
the wall that blocked his path.  A stronger robot might've been able to smash 
his way through and continue on.  Or a robot with a jetpack or boosters 
would've been able to fly to safety.  But this Predacon had none of those.

He reached into subspace, taking out his laser rifle and turning around, 
activating his comm. unit.  "This is Alabastor!  All Defcons get over here!  
They're after me!  Hurry the slag up!" he screamed into his shoulder comm. 
unit to his other gang members but got no reply.  He raised his pistol as he 
saw something move and fired off a single bolt, the superheated laser digging 
into the wall and leaving a small burned dent.

He focused, on realized it was nothing.  Just his imagination, but he was 
still frantic.  "I'm dead...I'm dead..." he said looking around, formulating 
a quick scheme.  He put away his rifle and took out his energon knife, 
climbing up on a couple stacked boxes and leaping, stabbing his blade into 
the wall.  It worked, as he was hanging on by the blade a few feet off the 
ground.  

He reached his free arm up as far as it would go, pulling himself slowly when 
suddenly a sound that reminded him of laser rang out and a burning sensation 
suddenly started in his back.  Alabastor lost his grip and fell in pain, 
slamming to the ground.

He shook his head, slowly getting to his feet, as painful as it was with the 
wound in his back, the electric guitar riffs over.  He looked around, 
spotting three robots.  

"You bastards..."

"Shut up, Alabastor.  We wouldn't suggest trying to call your friends.  
They're all dead."

"Wh--"

"No, shut up.  I wasn't finished quite yet.  You see," the robot said, 
beginning a small little tune on his electric guitar, which obviously wasn't 
plugged into anything so Alabastor was a little confused how he was playing 
it, but that was his least cocnern.

"You see," the robot continued, "you tried to muscle in on our turf.  But you 
didn't count on us, so we whiped you out."

"Most definately.  It was cake, man." one of the other robots said.

"Hey, shut up, man." the original robot said.  "Anyway, long story short, we 
don't like it, you betrayed us, and now you can die."

"But I didn't do it!  It was one of my Lieutenants!"

"Yeah, well," the robot said, starting with a complete riff on his guitar, 
turning a few dials, "we don't really care." he snickered, playing a quick 
hard riff, sonic waves tearing through the air towards Alabastor, Alabastor 
screaming in pain as he scratched at his insides, suddenly blowing up.

"That dude was lame."

"Most definately."
